alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 4:58AM AKST until January 23 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Glacier Bay. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 AM AKST, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain and snowmelt in areas around the Salmon River near the gravel pits, Rink Creek and Wilson Road. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Salmon River. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen during the last 24 hours. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1-0.2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are possible during the next 24 hours. - For Salmon River at Gustavus : At 4:15am the stage was 15.36 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.5 feet around 9 PM Saturday. Impacts: At 15.5 feet: Water will begin to flow over Wilson and Rink Creek roads and ditches will be full. Roads will be soft in places and travel across these areas will be difficult. At 16.5 feet: The Wilson and Rink Creek corridor will have 1-3 feet of water over the road to become impassable in places and structures will begin to flood. Power may be cut off from Chase Drive out to Rink Creek. - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
